image.altText: A boy chases a seagull, in front of a packed out swimming pool.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians make the most of the first heatwave of 2026, authorities are keeping a keen eye on reported high rates of dry grass and other bushfire risks.

title.children: Mainlanders may scoff but Tasmania is experiencing a severe heatwave

image.altText: Tasmanian ambulance in motion.

props.synopsis: A peak-hour crash on Hobart's Southern Outlet leads to 17 people being assessed at the Royal Hobart Hospital.

title.children: 17 people treated after bus, truck crash on Hobart's Southern Outlet

image.altText: A street with housing

props.synopsis: Three shootings have occurred in northern Hobart in the space of a week, with police saying two appear to be related.

title.children: Two people arrested following spate of Hobart shootings

image.altText: A pink substance in the beach tide.

props.synopsis: Scientists say a bioluminescent algae causes the red tides at the centre of recent environmentalist concerns — but that's not to say the magnificent display is totally harmless to marine life.

title.children: Is Tasmania's 'red tide' a brilliant light show or an environmental problem?

image.altText: An aerial shot of smoke rising from a fire in mountainous terrain.

props.synopsis: Large areas of Australia, from Western Australia's north-west to Tasmania's north-east, have been issued with severe to extreme heatwave warnings from Wednesday to Saturday. Follow our live blog.

title.children: Emergency warnings for fires in Victoria as heatwave sweeps across southern Australia

image.altText: A man wearing a green and grey spray jacket and white cap smiling with his hands resting on a white paling fence

props.synopsis: A retired detective has been remembered as an "incredibly moral and honest man" at a funeral service three weeks after he was killed in the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: 'It feels wrong': Final Bondi terror attack funeral held in Sydney

image.altText: A dark-haired, bearded man in a suit gestures as he speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Nicolás Maduro Guerra rose through the ranks of his father's government and remains in Caracas. It's uncertain for how long.

title.children: The US may have Nicolás Maduro but 'the prince' remains in Caracas

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and earrings looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: Angie Fuller has been missing for three years. Police are offering an equal record reward for information into what they believe is a suspected outback murder.

title.children: A vast expanse, a missing woman, and doubt she’s even out there at all

image.altText: Reserve Bank of Australia

props.synopsis: Inflation cooled in November, with the consumer price index rising 3.4 per cent over the year, down from 3.8 per cent a month earlier. Some economists continue to forecast a February rate hike, however.

title.children: 'Very pleasant surprise': inflation cools but remains above RBA target

image.altText: Jacob Bethell completes a shot through the off side

props.synopsis: Jacob Bethell's brilliant maiden Test century sets up an intriguing finish in Sydney, but leaves everyone bemused as to where this precocious young player has been all summer.

title.children: England's brightest hope and biggest blunder sets up Sydney finale

image.altText: A colourful illustrations shows the neon paths of computer circuits arranged to resemble an illuminated human brain.

props.synopsis: When a journalist emails a company with questions looking for answers, the least they expect is a real person to feed them the spin, half-truths or outright lies. Not a machine.

title.children: How an encounter with an AI hallucination raised an ethical dilemma

image.altText: Bobbi Lockyer wears a pink shirt and works on an Aboriginal art piece featuring turquoise blue water

props.synopsis: Indigenous artist Bobbi Lockyer has been left frustrated after she sent a $4,000 custom artwork of the Pilbara to a buyer in Queensland, only for an empty cardboard sleeve to be delivered.

title.children: Aboriginal artist Bobbi Lockyer in tears as Australia Post loses $4k painting

image.altText: A man with glasses and moustache leaves court with files under his left arm.

props.synopsis: Aldrich Ames, who was 84, betrayed Western intelligence assets to the Soviet Union and Russia in one of the most damaging intelligence breaches in US history.

title.children: Ex-CIA agent convicted of spying for Soviets dies in prison

image.altText: Vehicle in shipping container

props.synopsis: Queensland Police say 60 Toyota LandCruisers and Prados were stolen across Brisbane between October 20 and December 1.

title.children: Men charged over alleged international theft syndicate targeting Toyota 4WDs

image.altText: Green, red and yellow houses seen on the side of a white, snowy mountain alongside dark blue oceanwater

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's continued interest in Greenland is part of his "America First" agenda to dominate the Western Hemisphere and contain China's interests in the region.

title.children: Why does Trump want Greenland and why is it so important?

image.altText: A generic needle being filled for a cosmetic injectible.

props.synopsis: An AHPRA investigation found Thia Sullivan injected a patient without doctor consultation or a script, falsified records, and urged patients not to co-operate with police.

title.children: Brisbane cosmetic nurse banned for two years over unlawful injections, false records

image.altText: A man stands on a hillside with trees, holding a large map of the E1 project.

props.synopsis: Critics say the E1 project would prevent the establishment of a contiguous Palestinian state.

title.children: Israel cleared to start West Bank settlement construction

image.altText: A person inserts a needle into a dose of Pfizer vaccine.

props.synopsis: Bayer's Monsanto has sued Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna for allegedly misusing its messenger RNA technology in COVID vaccines.

title.children: Bayer's Monsanto sues COVID vaccine makers for alleged mRNA infringement

image.altText: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban smile, with their arms around each other.

props.synopsis: After 19 years as one of the entertainment world's most recognisable couples, actor Nicole Kidman and musician Keith Urban are officially divorced.

title.children: Kidman and Urban divorce after two decades as red carpet power couple

image.altText: Collage of Bloc Party's Kele Okereke and Arctic Monkeys's Alex Turner with guitars. Plus, Sarah Blasko and Martha Wainwright

props.synopsis: Arctic Monkeys were that low!? These are the tunes from triple j's Hottest 100 of 20. years ago that deserved to have placed higher.

title.children: These songs from the Hottest 100 of 2005 deserved better

image.altText: a large pile of sandy seaweed on a beach next to a digger and a truck

props.synopsis: Piles of kelp were removed from a popular Sydney beach, although some councils prefer to leave the seaweed for its environmental benefit.

title.children: Diggers remove 50 tonnes of seaweed from Sydney beach as masses wash up

image.altText: A two-storey building with a new garden, park benches and shade

props.synopsis: South Australia's doctors' union has raised concerns that clinicians were distressed when asked to admit more patients at a new mental health unit at Noarlunga Hospital when staffing levels were "not clinically safe".

title.children: Staff at new Adelaide mental health unit 'visibly distressed and crying', union says

image.altText: A still image from CCTV vision of seven boys dressed in jumpers and long pants walking along a footpath beside a waterway.

props.synopsis: Police are seeking help from the public to identify a group of teenagers wanted over what detectives have described as an ambush and machete attack in Caroline Springs, in Melbourne's west, last week.

title.children: Machete ambush after teenagers lured to park in Melbourne's west

image.altText: two men in tram conductor uniforms hang out of a tram in Kolkata

props.synopsis: Melbourne's iconic trams thrive in a car-centred world, but Asia's oldest tramway is now facing extinction.

title.children: Melbourne tram enthusiasts fight to save India's last tram network

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building that reads "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entrance.

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old woman has been charged with attempted murder after allegedly stabbing a man with a steak knife.

title.children: Canberra woman charged with attempted murder after stabbing

image.altText: Red, green, blue and yellow glass along exterior of QVB

props.synopsis: Dozens of people express opposition against a proposal to remove some of Queen Victoria Building's iconic coloured glass windows, after a development application stated they were not "fit for purpose in the eyes of global retail brands".

title.children: 'High volume' response after application for QVB windows to be made clear

image.altText: A young, bearded man with spiky hair, apparently in a bathroom.

props.synopsis: Two men are set to face court over the alleged murder of another prisoner in a Queensland jail.

title.children: Two men charged over alleged prison murder

image.altText: Tennis player Emerson Jones hitting a ball with her racquet

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old was aggressive in the opening set, but a broken racquet string knocked her focus and allowed her opponent to gain complete control of the match.

title.children: Rising teen star Jones falls short in debut Brisbane International bid

image.altText: blowfly

props.synopsis: Forecast heatwave conditions across large parts of the country could mean flies and maggots are more prevalent. Here's how to deal with them.

title.children: How to avoid fly and maggot infestations in your home

image.altText: Farmers work to pick their spinach crop at Dicky Bill Farm in Gippsland.

props.synopsis: About 160 staff lost their jobs when Dicky Bill collapsed owing up to $10 million. Two separate businesses have stepped in to take over, but not all operations will reopen.

title.children: Workers rehired as new managers revive Dicky Bill salad farms

image.altText: An outback landscape with a sign that reads Barrow Creek.

props.synopsis: The Barrow Creek Hotel was thrust into the global spotlight during the investigation into British backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance. Now its liquor licence has been suspended for breaching Northern Territory licensing laws.

title.children: Remote pub at centre of Peter Falconio mystery has liquor licence suspended

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron and Volodymyr Zelenskyy warmly shake hands behind a lectern.

props.synopsis: At a key meeting in Paris, officials from Europe, Canada, the US and NATO say they will provide Kyiv's frontline forces with equipment and training, and back them up with air, land and sea support to deter any future Russian attack.

title.children: Europe, US and NATO leaders agree to provide security guarantees to Ukraine

image.altText: drone shot of boats lined at windy harbour boat ramp

props.synopsis: WA's new ban on demersal fishing sees fishers flock to a coastal hamlet unaffected by the new rules, but locals say the crowds are unsustainable.

title.children: Coastal hamlet bears brunt of WA's new fishing crackdown

image.altText: A view of a coastal city with small houses and greenery with the water curving around the coast and mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: Australians are among hundreds of tourists scrambling to leave a remote Yemeni island, as a crisis on the mainland between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates causes travel chaos.

title.children: Australians trapped on Yemeni island after flare-up between Saudis and UAE

image.altText: A girl sits on the floor hunched in a corner next to a cupboard, peering over her knees.

props.synopsis: Emails show staff working at Berry Street residential care homes may have been exposed to ice by children using drugs at its facilities.

title.children: Care workers say they are powerless to stop children using ice
